column3: str
In barren fields afar, I sense the stirring of dire foes. Those who wander shall make a stand...and you shall serve as their beacon. I, too, mean to confront this rising threat.
Ere we stride into battle, however, let us steep our souls in song─aye, a performance in your honor...
<hex:021A020203>Dawn may banish even the darkest night,<hex:02100103>Yet ever shall primal desires burn.<hex:021A020103>
<hex:021A020203>Two swords shall vie to lay them low─<hex:02100103>A blade born of light and a blade forged of might.<hex:02100103>Alas, man may entrust his fate unto but one.<hex:021A020103>
Truly, Archon Louisoix had a gift with words. Had circumstances been different, he would have made a magnificent minstrel...
You desire an encore? Very well, it would be my pleasure.
<hex:022903EB0203>, I give you <hex:021A020203>Ultima's Bane<hex:021A020103>!
From an era long forgotten,♪<hex:02100103>A blade of midnight drawn,♪<hex:02100103>From a battlefield awakened,♪<hex:02100103>A warrior who bears the dawn...♪
From an era long forgotten,♪<hex:02100103>A blade of midnight drawn,♪<hex:02100103>From a distant land uncharted,♪<hex:02100103>A warrior who bears the dawn...♪
Ever since I first set foot in these lands, I have been haunted by a song.
It foretold the coming of the Seventh Umbral Era, and of those who would deliver us from doom...
Of course, I need not speak to you and yours of the prophetess Mezaya Thousand Eyes's words.
For in the fires of Carteneau, you witnessed the truth of the <hex:021A020203>Divine Chronicles<hex:021A020103>...
And when you emerged from the Praetorium triumphant, you proved yourself a Warrior of Light to the world once more.
<hex:021A020203>Ne'er till land consumes sun can sea bear moons,<hex:02100103>Heavens spew crimson flame, hells seep black dooms.<hex:021A020103>
<hex:021A020203>Stray seeds quicken in ash's grey embrace,<hex:02100103>Valiant blades forged under the Twelve's good grace.<hex:021A020103>
The words of the prophetess Mezaya Thousand Eyes as writ in her <hex:021A020203>Divine Chronicles<hex:021A020103>.
The “crimson flames” of Dalamud heralded the end of an era...
And the “valiant blades” that were the Warriors of Light brought us hope in our darkest hour.
<hex:021A020203>Seven waning moons see seven suns rise,<hex:02100103>Divine order roils, fallen corpses writhe.<hex:021A020103>
<hex:021A020203>Souls from aether far, strangers from strange lands,<hex:02100103>Yester with thine eyes, morrow by thine hands.<hex:021A020103>
We knew not whom the verses spoke of─not I, nor the Archons, nor any other soul in the realm.
The Warriors of Light were lost to us. If not them, who could it be?
And then came the rumors of one not unlike them─a <hex:02080FE905FF06>woman<hex:FF04>man<hex:03> who walked in the light of the Crystal.
From the moment I saw you, I felt it must be true. Having learned of your deeds in their entirety, I now <hex:021A020203>know<hex:021A020103> it to be true.
You are as they were, <hex:022C0DFF07><hex:022903EB0203><hex:FF02> <hex:0203>─a Warrior of Light, and an inspiration to us all.
<hex:021A020203>Lances of light herald the dawn,<hex:02100103>Beckoning shadows deeper still.<hex:021A020103>
<hex:021A020203>Splendor dances with shades<hex:02100103>Unsheathed, a rime-kissed blade<hex:02100103>Spills crimson o'er fields of white.<hex:021A020103>
Archon Louisoix warned us that shadows will accompany the coming of dawn. In answer to ascendant Light, Darkness will gather in opposition...or so I interpret his words.
What “a rime-kissed blade” signifies, I cannot yet fathom. But I have heard that roses of blood are blooming in the white fields of Coerthas, in ever greater profusion.
The Twelve keep and defend you, <hex:022C0DFF07><hex:022903EB0203><hex:FF02> <hex:0203>. What tales you'll have to tell when next we meet!

Into the flesh of Darkness go bringers of Light,♪<hex:02100103>for the flame that flickers in Bahamut's tomb.♪<hex:02100103>In that cloying black stirs a raven white,♪<hex:02100103>clawing blood from a barren womb.♪
What was slain in silver proud did in golden malice rise.♪<hex:02100103>Metals of infamy and ruin, that every hero must despise.♪
Do these verses ring a bell, perchance? I wrote this song to immortalize your journey into Dalamud's Shadow.

One of my most requested songs, especially in those halls and taverns frequented by adventurers. Oftentimes, I can save my voice in the later verses, for the whole place is on its feet by then, belting out the words by heart...

A touch hyperbolic? Why, 'tis the broad strokes that make a popular ballad! Else we would be singing of mending socks and sitting on cushions, would we not? We shall talk again soon─tell me more tales of derring-do, won't you?
